item.title: Ernest Chausson's beautifu Poème and Turgenev's story
item.description: Chausson composed Poème, a one movement violin-orchestra piece 3 years before he died. So beautiful, mysterious, and sexy, this is one of my favouite music ever. His inspiration came from Ivan Turgenev’s novel, The Song of Triumphant Love. I spent an hour to read this novel one night. It is an interesting story. It’s about 2 friends, one of them a painter and the other a musician, fell in love with same woman.

item.title: Some notes on the 4 noble truths
item.description: I’ve just started to study a course on Coursera called “Buddhism and Modern Psychology”. I find it very interesting. The purpose of the course is not all about religion, but rather with the help of buddhism and modern psychology, how to find happiness and peace in life. item.title: Some thoughts after reading the Little Prince
item.description: The Little Prince is one of my favorite books as a kid. The writer meets a little prince when his plane crashed into Sahara, and the little prince is from a planet far away. He has a rose that he really loves and takes care of, while a fox wants to be tamed by him. These are the two little stories in the book that touches my heart the most.
